ygData.subject: Grouping Story / Question
ygData.msgSnippet: Last night, I was in the best group ever.  Within the space of 5 hours, I went from 1 bubble away from 26, to one bubble inside 28! The group consisted of:
ygData.messageBody:
Last night, I was in the best group ever. Within the space of 5 hours, I
went from 1 bubble away from 26, to one bubble inside 28!

The group consisted of:
Bard (me)
Monk
Warrior/Paladin
Ranger
Rogue
Mage

We handled pulls of 3, and even 4 (once I got the hang of charming..heh).

Is it just me, or is a tank/melee heavy group like the one described above
better than a caster heavy group, or even a melee/caster balanced group?
Never before had I been in a group that handled so many mobs, within that
amount of time, and only once did any group member ever drop below two
bubbles of health. She did a FD, and at half, got up, and helped us finish
off the *group* of mobs we had at the time. Oh, wait, the rogue got beat up
once...but didn't die...hehe.

Was it the group, or does the charm song make that much of a difference?

I'm amazed...I can't for the life of me figure out what was suddenly so
right about being a bard in a group...and getting that much xp. Hehe...

Atonal the rambler... :)
